name: Chegg
title: AI Disruption Victim: Dramatic Workforce Reduction

classification.classificationRationale: Insufficient data to classify AI organizational structure. The available data documents Chegg as a company disrupted BY AI (losing business to AI-powered alternatives) rather than one implementing AI internally. The 45% workforce reduction was a defensive response to AI competition, not evidence of how they structure AI work. No information available about internal AI teams, reporting structures, or transformation initiatives.

description:
Chegg represents a cautionary case of AI disruption rather than AI transformation. The education technology company, known for homework help and textbook rentals, has been severely impacted by generative AI tools like ChatGPT that can perform similar tutoring and homework assistance functions.

In October 2025, Chegg cut 45% of its workforce, explicitly citing the 'new realities of AI' alongside reduced Google traffic as the primary drivers. This represents one of the most dramatic AI-attributed workforce reductions in percentage terms among public companies. The layoffs signal a company in defensive retreat rather than offensive transformation.

The available data does not reveal how Chegg has structured any internal AI initiatives or whether they have an AI team, lab, or transformation strategy. This specimen documents the disruptive impact of AI on incumbent business models rather than organizational approaches to AI adoption.

observableMarkers.resourceAllocation: Massive workforce reduction (45%) suggests defensive cost-cutting rather than AI investment reallocation

This specimen currently has no structural model because the data shows disruption impact, not organizational adaptation.
